string_table.name: pxabnsnfns10111110111
string_table.string: Use the w, a, s, and d keys to move around the 360 degree image. Press the tab key to jump to interactive markers and hotspots.
To watch this video, use the preview feature in Storyline 360, upload your published output to a server, publish to Review 360, or switch to static video quality.
Streaming video is unavailable for local playback.

search.slidetext: lessening digital addiction in elementary students by: maci mutzner
introduction
big idea to provide information and helpful tips on how educators can prevent and lessen digital addiction in students.
navigation instructions click the arrow on the bottom right corner to navigate through the lesson.
instructor email if you need to reach me for any reason, my email is: mutzner.2@wright.edu

assessment (slider) directions: drag the slider to the appropriate expression that you feel is best for the question below. question: how confident are you with any information you may previously know about digital addiction in elementary students?

assessment (dial) directions: use the dial to choose which expression is most appropriate to how you feel about the question below. question: how do you feel about elementary students being addicted to technology?
needed technology to complete this interactive lesson, you will need a computer with working internet.
triggering phase
digital addiction during this lesson, students will be learning how to lessen digital addiction in elementary students.

directions: before we get started with the lesson, please type a response in the box to the question below. you need to include at least three complete sentences in your answer. question: in your opinion, what are some of the conflicts that digital addiction will cause for a young student? assessment (essay)
assessment debrief one of the biggest conflicts that digital addiction causes is mental health issues.
digital addiction this is a harmful dependence on digital media and digital devices.
directions: in the box below, type in a number that answers the question below. question: how many people in the world do you think use social media? assessment (how many)
assessment debrief the amount of social media users across the world is 4.9 billion.
common signs there are many signs that a child has a digital addiction.
assessment (short answer) directions: type your short answer in the box to the question below. question: how can educators limit screen time in the classroom?
assessment debrief educators can limit screen time by providing lessons that do not involve technology.
exploration phase
maladaptive behaviors children's addiction to digital devices compares to other maladaptive behaviors.
electronic policy educators should create an electronic policy poster with their students.

thank you asking the teacher permission to use the laptop, being safe while using the laptop, not getting on non school friendly websites are some good options! continue continue continue continue continue continue assessment (text entry) directions: type your answer to the following question in the text field below. question: what is a rule that could go on the electronics policy poster for your classroom?
policy consequences when implementing a policy, you have to also implement consequences.

incorrect that is incorrect. please try again. try again try again try again try again try again try again incorrect you did not select the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct that's right! you selected the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue assessment directions: answer the question below by dragging the correct answers to the checkmark and the wrong answers to the trash can. question: which of the following shapes below show signs of digital addiction? all they talk about is electronics lose interest in activities not involving technology they lose sleep from staying up late playing video games every night
dasc recently, a digital addiction scale for children was created and is primarily used for young children.

incorrect that is incorrect. please try again. try again try again try again try again try again try again incorrect you did not select the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct that's right! you selected the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue assessment (pick one) directions: click on the shape below that has the correct answer. question: why do you think digital addiction and social media would have a negative effect on a child's psychological well being? the child is constantly comparing their lives to another child's the child is constantly comparing their lives to another child's the child is constantly comparing their lives to another child's the child is making friends and having fun the child is making friends and having fun the child is making friends and having fun the child is learning information about hobbies they might want to try the child is learning information about hobbies they might want to try the child is learning information about hobbies they might want to try
assessment debrief children who are heavily involved in social media and technology have a risk of being victims of cyberbullying.
integration phase
case study instructions please follow all the instructions on the following slides to complete the case study.
case study questions there will be three questions during this case study. it should take about 30 minutes to complete.
characters during this case study, there will be two characters, abby and chloe. hi! my name is abby. and i’m chloe!

conversation #1 good morning chloe, i am having an issue with a student and need your help. nice to see you abby, what is going on with your student? my student has been sleeping during lessons, he will be on his laptop when he is not supposed to and when i tell him he needs to put his laptop away and be involved in the activity we are doing, he gets very angry. that’s not good. have you asked him if he is getting any sleep at home? yes, he says he stays up late every night playing video games. i also asked if he is allowed to be up late doing that and he says his grandma doesn’t care. well that definitely explains why he is sleeping in class. what is he doing on his laptop when he is on it during classtime? he is usually playing math games which is great, but not when we are in the middle of a language arts lesson. well let’s figure out some solutions that could fix this situation.

incorrect that is incorrect. please try again. try again try again try again try again try again try again incorrect you did not select the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct that's right! you selected the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue take the laptop away and do not let the student ever use it in school again. take the laptop away and do not let the student ever use it in school again. take the laptop away and do not let the student ever use it in school again. take the laptop away and do not let the student ever use it in school again. take the laptop away and do not let the student ever use it in school again. take the laptop away and do not let the student ever use it in school again. call the parents and tell them to take all electronics away from the student. call the parents and tell them to take all electronics away from the student. call the parents and tell them to take all electronics away from the student. call the parents and tell them to take all electronics away from the student. call the parents and tell them to take all electronics away from the student. call the parents and tell them to take all electronics away from the student. establish an “electronics policy” that is put in the classroom where it is always visible to students. establish an “electronics policy” that is put in the classroom where it is always visible to students. establish an “electronics policy” that is put in the classroom where it is always visible to students. establish an “electronics policy” that is put in the classroom where it is always visible to students. establish an “electronics policy” that is put in the classroom where it is always visible to students. establish an “electronics policy” that is put in the classroom where it is always visible to students. assessment directions: for this assessment, you will be answering the question below by clicking on the answer. question: what is a solution that abby can implement to try to reduce screen time when it is not an appropriate time?
assessment debrief the correct answer to the assessment was: establish an “electronics policy” that is put in the classroom where it is always visible to students.

conversation #2 hey chloe, so i created a poster of my class’s “electronic policy” and the student did good for a few days, but now he is back to using his laptop when he is not supposed to. great job on creating a policy! do the students have consequences if they do not follow the policy? i haven’t explained any consequences but maybe i should..

incorrect that is incorrect. please try again. try again try again try again try again try again try again incorrect you did not select the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct that's right! you selected the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue assessment (drag-and-drop) directions: abby is now going to add consequences for when students are not abiding to the “electronics policy”. drag the correct answers to the poster. student has to sit in hallway for the rest of the day student receives a verbal warning student can never bring their laptop to school again student gets laptop taken away for remainder of the day and will have to use pencil and paper instead student can play on laptop as long as they want student gets a phone call home

assessment debrief the correct answers were: student receives a verbal warning, student gets laptop taken away for remainder of the day and will have to use pencil and paper instead, and student gets a phone call home.

conversation #3 hello chloe, ever since i implemented what the consequences would be for not following the policy, the student rarely gets on his laptop when he is not supposed to! that is wonderful news! is there anything else you are going to do regarding electronics in the classroom? yes, i want to limit the amount of time we use electronics for lessons because i want the students to be able to learn hands on and not just rely on a laptop. i think that is a smart idea. we have a lot of nice weather coming up so you could even try to get the students outside. let me know if you need my help!

incorrect that is incorrect. please try again. try again try again try again try again try again try again incorrect you did not select the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct that's right! you selected the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue have students complete a worksheet have students complete a worksheet have students complete a worksheet have students complete a worksheet have students complete a worksheet have students complete a worksheet take the students outside for the lesson and provide hands on activities take the students outside for the lesson and provide hands on activities take the students outside for the lesson and provide hands on activities take the students outside for the lesson and provide hands on activities take the students outside for the lesson and provide hands on activities take the students outside for the lesson and provide hands on activities let the students watch a video about the water cycle and let them use their laptops anyway let the students watch a video about the water cycle and let them use their laptops anyway let the students watch a video about the water cycle and let them use their laptops anyway let the students watch a video about the water cycle and let them use their laptops anyway let the students watch a video about the water cycle and let them use their laptops anyway let the students watch a video about the water cycle and let them use their laptops anyway directions: read the question below and select which answer you think is correct. question: abby is trying to limit screen time in her classroom. her students are currently learning about the water cycle. how can she teach this lesson while avoiding screen time? assessment
assessment debrief the correct answer for the previous assessment is “take the students outside for the lesson and provide hands on activities”.
resolution phase
name input for quiz completion directions: please type your name in the box below so that you can get credit for completing this quiz.
quiz instructions follow the directions on each slide to answer each quiz question.
quiz expectations there are five total questions and should take you about 25 minutes.
criteria for success you must score at least an 80% to successfully pass this quiz and receive your certificate.

incorrect you did not select the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct that's right! you selected the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue false false false false false false directions: read the question below and click on the correct answer. question: it is not possible for someone to have a digital addiction. true true true true true true

incorrect you did not select the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct that's right! you selected the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue silent reading time silent reading time silent reading time silent reading time silent reading time silent reading time educational games on the laptop educational games on the laptop educational games on the laptop educational games on the laptop educational games on the laptop educational games on the laptop setting a timer when students have free time on their laptop setting a timer when students have free time on their laptop setting a timer when students have free time on their laptop setting a timer when students have free time on their laptop setting a timer when students have free time on their laptop setting a timer when students have free time on their laptop taking the students outside for a lesson taking the students outside for a lesson taking the students outside for a lesson taking the students outside for a lesson taking the students outside for a lesson taking the students outside for a lesson letting students watch educational videos on youtube letting students watch educational videos on youtube letting students watch educational videos on youtube letting students watch educational videos on youtube letting students watch educational videos on youtube letting students watch educational videos on youtube calling the students parents and telling them to take away all of the students electronics until they’re in high school calling the students parents and telling them to take away all of the students electronics until they’re in high school calling the students parents and telling them to take away all of the students electronics until they’re in high school calling the students parents and telling them to take away all of the students electronics until they’re in high school calling the students parents and telling them to take away all of the students electronics until they’re in high school calling the students parents and telling them to take away all of the students electronics until they’re in high school directions: read the question below and select the correct answer(s). question: what are ways that a teacher can limit the amount of screen time in their classroom?

incorrect you did not select the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct that's right! you selected the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue directions: read the question below and type your answer in the box. question: teachers should create an electronics ______ poster that they hang up in their classroom where it is visible to students.

incorrect you did not select the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct that's right! you selected the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue never allowing the student to bring their laptop to school again never allowing the student to bring their laptop to school again never allowing the student to bring their laptop to school again never allowing the student to bring their laptop to school again never allowing the student to bring their laptop to school again never allowing the student to bring their laptop to school again taking the laptop only for the remainder of the school day taking the laptop only for the remainder of the school day taking the laptop only for the remainder of the school day taking the laptop only for the remainder of the school day taking the laptop only for the remainder of the school day taking the laptop only for the remainder of the school day directions: read the question below and then click on the answer. question: which of the following should not be a consequence for breaking the electronics policy? verbal warning verbal warning verbal warning verbal warning verbal warning verbal warning phone call home phone call home phone call home phone call home phone call home phone call home

incorrect you did not select the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct that's right! you selected the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue students can use the laptop whenever they need it students must get permission to use their laptop students can break their laptop students can get on non school friendly websites students can video chat with friends directions: read the question below and drag the answer into the box. question: what is a rule that could go on your electronics policy poster?
book recommendation internet addiction in children and adolescents by kimberly s. young
thank you thank you so much for participating in my interactive lesson!

work cited 6 top tips for managing technology in the classroom. 2016 august 27. gradelink. https:// www.gradelink.com/managing-technology-in-the-classroom/ huffman, m. (2023 april 24). social media and mental health learning module. open educational resources. https://oercommons.org/courseware/lesson/103088 schulz van endert, t. (2021). addictive use of digital devices in young children: associations with delay discounting, self-control and academic performance. plos one, 16(6), 1-12. https:// eds-s-ebscohost-com.ezproxy.libraries.wright.edu/eds/detail/detail?vid=11&sid=af9dea4f- 8e8f-4e1f-a21f-e32fa1052241%40redis&bdata=jnnpdgu9zwrzlwxpdmu %3d#an=151026435&db=a9h

terms.term: Is a harmful dependence on digital media and devices such as smartphones, video games, and computers.
